org.jetel.graph

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractJobflowComponent, Aggregate, AggregateOld, AproxMergeJoin, BulkLoader, CheckForeignKey, CloverDataReader, CloverDataWriter, Concatenate, DataGenerator, DataIntersection, DataReader, DataWriter, DB2DataWriter, DBExecute, DBFDataReader, DBFDataWriter, DBInputTable, DBJoin, DBOutputTable, Dedup, DelimitedDataReader, DelimitedDataWriter, Denormalizer, ExtFilter, ExtSort, Filter, FixLenDataReader, FixLenDataWriter, HadoopReader, HadoopWriter, HashJoin, HttpConnector, InfobrightDataWriter, JavaExecute, JmsReader, JmsWriter, JsonExtract, KeyGenerator, LdapReader, LdapWriter, LookupJoin, LookupTableReaderWriter, Merge, MergeJoin, Normalizer, Partition, Reformat, Rollup, RunGraph, SequenceChecker, SimpleCopy, SimpleGather, Sort, SortWithinGroups, SpeedLimiter, StructureWriter, SystemExecute, TextTableWriter, Trash, TreeReader, TreeWriter, XLSReader, XLSWriter, XMLExtract, XmlWriter, XmlXPathReader, XSLDataTransformer

    public abstract class Node
extends GraphElement
implements java.lang.Runnable, CloverWorkerListener
    A class that represents atomic transformation task. It is a base class for all kinds of transformation components.
    Since:
    April 2, 2002
    See Also:
    org.jetel.component

    • Field Detail

      • childThreads

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Thread> childThreads
        List of all threads under this component. For instance parallel reader uses threads for parallel reading. It is component's responsibility to register all inner threads via addChildThread() method.

        protected int outPortsSize

      • tokenTracker

        protected ComponentTokenTracker tokenTracker
        Component token tracker encapsulates graph's token tracker. All jobflow logging for this component should be provided through this tracker. Tracker cannot be null, at least PrimitiveComponentTokenTracker is used.

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.free() method.
        Specified by:
        init in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        init in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • writeRecord

        public void writeRecord(int _portNum,
               DataRecord _record)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        An operation that writes one record through specified output port.
        As this operation gets the Port object from TreeMap, don't use it in loops or when time is critical. Instead obtain the Port object directly and use it's writeRecord() method.
        Parameters:
        _portNum - Description of Parameter
        _record - Description of Parameter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of Exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Description of Exception
        Since:
        April 2, 2002

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:
        checkConfig in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        checkConfig in class GraphElement

      • checkInputPorts

        protected boolean checkInputPorts(ConfigurationStatus status,
                      int min,
                      int max,
                      boolean checkNonAssignedPorts)
        Checks number of input ports, whether is in the given interval.
        Parameters:
        status -
        min -
        max -
        checkNonAssignedPorts - should be checked non-assigned ports (for example first port without edge and second port with edge)
        Returns:
        true if the number of input ports is in the given interval; else false

      • registerChildThread

        public void registerChildThread(java.lang.Thread childThread)
        The given thread is registered as a child thread of this component. The child threads are exploited for gathering of tracking information - CPU usage of this component is sum of all threads.
        Parameters:
        childThread -

      • unregisterChildThread

        public void unregisterChildThread(java.lang.Thread childThread)
        The given thread is unregistered from this node. Should be invoked by the child thread right before the thread finish.
        Parameters:
        childThread -

      • registerChildThreads

        protected void registerChildThreads(java.util.List<java.lang.Thread> childThreads)
        The given threads are registered as child threads of this component. The child threads are exploited for gathering of tracking information - for instance CPU usage of this component is sum of all threads.
        Parameters:
        childThreads -

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.

      • getTokenTracker

        public ComponentTokenTracker getTokenTracker()

        token tracker for this component or null cannot be returned, at least PrimitiveComponentTokenTracker is returned.

      • createComponentTokenTracker

        protected ComponentTokenTracker createComponentTokenTracker()
        Creates suitable token tracker for this component. ComplexComponentTokenTracker is used by default. This method is intended to be overridden if custom type of token tracking is necessary.

      • checkEofOnInputPorts

        protected boolean checkEofOnInputPorts()
        Can be overridden by components to avoid default checking of input ports - all input ports are checked whether EOF flag was reached after the component finish processing.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        com.cloveretl.server.graph.RemoteEdgeDataTransmitter

      • waitForEdgesEOF

        protected void waitForEdgesEOF()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method blocks current thread until all input and output edges are complete - last record is read, EOF indicator is reached.
